monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.

spanGrp.span: It is said that in the past, but let's say now we want to buy some wool.
We buy the wool from the market, or we get it from those who slaughter the animals.
The ones who slaughter the halal animals. We bring it, let’s say, how much do we bring? For example, I want to make...
I want to make ten quilts for the house – ten quilts – I want to make ten quilts.
I bring the wool, let's say, we spread it out and wash it. We clean it first, let's say, so that the... completely disappears.
Even the bedding, the bedding made from sheep wool, is... it is said that it... let's say it is all full of manure. – 'Al-galag' – 'Al-galag'
We spread it out and wash it well, meaning, let's say, two or three times or more until it gets clean.
We hit all of this on a washing board. It's tiring. And after we finish shaking it, we wash it.
Then we let the water penetrate it, and then we take it out of the water.
We take it out properly and place it under the sun. As soon as it dries, we bring, let's say, the bedding.
We cut it to the size of the quilt, and how much it is, let's say two meters in length and two meters in width. So, we make the quilt in the shape of a square.
We stuff the wool. We weigh the wool. In the past, the quantity was estimated by sight by the women, but today it is all weighed.
The quilt weighs six or seven kilograms. I weigh the wool, and we now make it easier like this for the bedding.
We insert it into the bedding. After finishing it, the bedding needs a cover, so we make it at home.
Ancient people, in the past, not everyone could make the quilt (i.e., produce it). Making a quilt was difficult.
It is said that grandmothers in the past would roll it up and carry it on a pole like this. There would be one woman who knew how to do it in the whole village.
Today, flag makers know how to make it at home.
After that, we want, let's say, to make the wool easier and shape it like this, where we roll it, meaning inside it.
It means there is a method: we place it from the top like this and roll it, and it goes inside.
There is a method. After that, we sew the opening of the bedding. Once we finish sewing, we bring the thread and needle.
Let's say that the quilt thread is different from the bedding thread.
The quilt thread is thin, and the bedding thread is thick. The regular sewing thread is even finer. Each thread is different depending on its use; the one for the quilt is thinner.
Then we beat it. We keep beating it relentlessly until we reach the center.
Then we spread it out. Yes, we keep beating it, holding it like this and beating it.
Let's say the elderly woman also prepares three or four needles, and we keep beating it until it is completely ready, meaning the quilt is prepared.
After that, we spread it out like this to make it ready for sewing. It shrinks a little.
We spread it out and bring the special needle for it, then we sew it, stitching the quilt.
And the same goes for the bedding. We bring the bedding, where its wool is plentiful.
The bedding needs at least 10 or 15 kilograms, it’s a lot. Even for a bride, they prepare it with 30 kilograms!
The bride's bedding is 30 kilograms. We need, let's say, 15 kilograms for the house.
Then we bring it and cut it in the same way, so it fits the size of the bedding. The bedding is easier and doesn't require as much effort as the quilt.
Similarly, we put the wool inside it and sew the opening of the bedding. Then, we beat it and smooth it out, this bedding as well.
Similarly for the pillows. The pillow, depending on its size, we stuff it. We sew its opening. But for the pillow, we don’t beat it. We don't beat the pillow.
We only sew its opening and smooth it out. This is for the pillow, right!
Here, let's say, the woman who is getting married, we Arabs give great attention to the wool, meaning they take a lot of it.
10 blankets, 10 quilts, 15 pillows, 4 or 5 mattresses. A lot!
For example, these bedding covers were given to me in the past.
As for today, let's say people have become more advanced. No one makes a lot anymore. Two quilts, two bedding sets, and four pillows. And may God bless you.
